discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Use the Special Handling Notes application to create notes that bring important information about individual records to the user's attention.

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/c_OnScreenAlerts.html

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/configure-special-handling-notes.html#:~:text=Use%20special%20handling%20notes%20to,information%20to%20an%20agent's%20attention.&text=Configure%20the%20desired%20entity%20tables,list%20or%20pop%2Dup%20window.

choices.D: Help agents identify in which time zone a contact is located
choices.C: To ensure customers get the service they are entitled to receive
choices.A: Bring important information about individual records to an agent's attention
choices.B: For agents to view articles an attach them to a case

questions.question_text: What are Special Handling Notes used for?

A customer service manager would like to limit the reading and creation of knowledge articles within a specific Knowledge Base to the Customer Support group only. Which features should be used to accomplish this? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
- Can Read: 

Users can read knowledge articles in the knowledge base.

- Cannot Contribute: 

Users can't create, modify, retire, or read knowledge articles in the knowledge base.

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-servicenow-platform/page/product/knowledge-management/task/t_SelectUserCriteria.html

comments.content: It could be A if we remove the Customer Support group from the Can Read User Criteria.

discussion.content:
Cannot be A since we want to limit the reading. 
I think it is CD.

Selected Answer: AD
AD is Correct

choices.C: Hide the Knowledge Base from the Knowledge Base Portal
choices.B: Whitelist all other groups from the Knowledge Base

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
No automatic creation of child cases. doesn't make sense

Selected Answer: B
B should be correct

questions.question_text: In case management, Parent Child Synchronization allows for which of the following:

choices.C: Child cases to be separated from Parent cases and will not be synchronized automatically
choices.D: Synchronization of all child cases as well as children of child cases on all levels
choices.B: Parent cases to automatically generate child cases when all fields are filled out thus synchronized auto-population
choices.A: Enabling the Customer Service agent to create cases so that all the children cases can be managed by managing the parent case

questions.question_text: Which predefined conversations are available for Customer Service Virtual Agent? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
BD is Correct.

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/csm-virtual-agent-chatbot.html

comments.content:
If the customer rejects the proposed solution, move the case back to the Open state. If the customer rejected the proposed solution from the Customer or Consumer Service Portal, the state of the case automatically updates to Open.

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-financial-services-operations/page/product/fso-payment-operations/task/propose-solution-inquiry-case.html#:~:text=If%20the%20customer%20rejects%20the,back%20to%20the%20Open%20state.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/resolve-cases-consumer-portal.html#:~:text=Rejects%20the%20solution%20proposed%20by,state%20changes%20to%20Open%20state.

Selected Answer: B
Rejects the solution proposed by the agent after entering the reason for rejecting the solution. The case state changes to Open state.
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/resolve-cases-consumer-portal.html

questions.question_text: What will be the state of a case after a customer rejects the solution proposed by an agent?
